thread.title: Cubs hit 6 home runs, top Cardinals for 2-1 lead in NLDS
thread.title_full: Cubs hit 6 home runs, top Cardinals for 2-1 lead in NLDS

title: Cubs hit 6 home runs, top Cardinals for 2-1 lead in NLDS
text:
Cubs hit 6 home runs, top Cardinals for 2-1 lead in NLDS Published: Monday, Oct. 12, 2015 8:58 p.m. CDT • Updated: Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015 12:52 a.m. CDT Caption (AP Photo/Nam Y. Huh) The Cubs' Jorge Soler hits a home run against the St. Louis Cardinals during the sixth inning of Game 3 in the National League Division Series on Monday at Wrigley Field. By JAY COHEN (AP) 
CHICAGO – Kris Bryant and Jorge Soler each hit two-run drives, and the Cubs connected for a postseason franchise-record six homers in an 8-6 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals in Game 3 of the NL Division Series on Monday. 
Kyle Schwarber, Anthony Rizzo, Starlin Castro and Dexter Fowler also homered, powering Jake Arrieta to another win despite a rare off night for the bearded ace. The Cubs' previous record for most homers in a playoff game was five in the opener of the 1984 NL Championship Series against San Diego. 
A third straight win for the Cubs on Tuesday afternoon, and the once woebegone franchise will advance to the NLCS for the first time in 12 years. The Cardinals, who led the majors with 100 wins this season, have won at least one playoff series in each of the past four years. 
Jason Heyward and Stephen Piscotty homered for St. Louis, and Jhonny Peralta had a run-scoring double.
